text: Charles Henry Emeleus (4 September 1930 â€“ 11 November 2017) was a British geologist. He was born in Belfast, England. He specialized in the Tertiary volcanic rocks of Britain and Greenland. Emeleus was a highly capable petrologist. The mineral emeleusite, a colourless sodium silicate, is named after Emeleus. In 2016, he received the Prestwich Medal. Emeleus died on 11 November 2017 in Durham, England at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2017 deaths Category:British geologists Category:Scientists from Belfast
title: Henry Emeleus
